notes: Turning invulnerable or hidden does not stop the Thunder Strike from hitting other units within the 240/650 radius.
Thunder Strike exposes the target.
The strikes first apply the debuff, then the damage.

Strikes the target in 2-second intervals, starting immediately as the debuff is placed, resulting in 4/7 strikes. The debuff persists through death. If the target dies, Thunder Strike continues to apply damage at its death location.
The debuff persists through death. If the target dies, Thunder Strike continues to apply damage at its death location.

Can deal up to 180/280/380/480 damage to a single unit (before reductions). With the level 10 damage increasing talent, it deals a total of 300/400/500/600 damage. With the level 20 number of strikes increasing talent, it deals a total of 315/490/665/840 damage. With both talents, it deals a total of 525/700/875/1050 damage.
With the level 10 damage increasing talent, it deals a total of 300/400/500/600 damage.
With the level 20 number of strikes increasing talent, it deals a total of 315/490/665/840 damage.
With both talents, it deals a total of 525/700/875/1050 damage.
The damage upgrading talent immediately upgrades all of Disruptor's currently active Thunder Strike instances.
However, the number of strikes increasing talent does not update currently active instances. The current instance must expire first.
The current instance must expire first.
Provides 450 range flying vision for 3.34 seconds at the target's last location when the debuff expires or is removed.
Successive casts on the same unit do not stack, but only refresh the duration.
abilities.description: Repeatedly strikes the targeted unit with lightning. Each strike damages nearby enemy units in a small radius and slows enemy movement speed and attack speed by 100 for seconds. Provides vision of its target.
params: Allows Thunder Strike to be cast on allies, follows the ally and deals damage around them. Each strike gives a short 1.25 second buff that provides +50% Movement Speed and +75 Attack Speed. Increases radius by 410 when used on allies.
Continues to apply area effect if debuff was placed before spell immunity and when not dispelled. Does not attempt to damage spell immune enemies. Can be cast on spell immune allies.
Blocked fully only when primary enemy target.
Disruptor's charged coils occasionally overload, and a singed armor plate or tuft of fur is the enemy's result.
abilities.story: Disruptor's charged coils occasionally overload, and a singed armor plate or tuft of fur is the enemy's result.

notes: Glimpse does not instantly move the target back. A projectile spawns from the target which travels towards the mark. The projectile travels at a speed of 600, or reaches the mark in 1.8 seconds, whichever is faster. The projectile provides 400 range flying vision while traveling, which lingers for 3.34 seconds at the marked location.
The projectile travels at a speed of 600, or reaches the mark in 1.8 seconds, whichever is faster.
The projectile provides 400 range flying vision while traveling, which lingers for 3.34 seconds at the marked location.
If the target was dead for more than 4 seconds, the target gets moved to the team's fountain instead. Cannot target creep-heroes.
Cannot target creep-heroes.

The location at which the target lands after Glimpse is marked with a blue visual effect which is visible to everyone. With the level 15 talent, Glimpse deals 275 damage to the target upon arriving at the mark.
With the level 15 talent, Glimpse deals 275 damage to the target upon arriving at the mark.

Does not move spell immune units, but can move invulnerable units. Following the general rule of position changing effects, it can cancel abilities Time Walk or Ball Lightning. While Doppelganger, Sleight of Fist and Activate Fire Remnant reposition the caster, they cannot be interrupted, these abilities can be used to dodge. Does not move hidden units.
Following the general rule of position changing effects, it can cancel abilities Time Walk or Ball Lightning.
While Doppelganger, Sleight of Fist and Activate Fire Remnant reposition the caster, they cannot be interrupted, these abilities can be used to dodge.
Does not move hidden units.
The target is given a stop command as soon as it is moved back, effectively canceling channeling abilities.
Does not disjoint projectiles for the target upon teleporting them.
abilities.description: Teleports the target hero back to where it was 4 seconds ago. Instantly kills illusions.
params: Does not return enemies while spell immune.
Playing with electricity can have unexpected results.
abilities.story: Playing with electricity can have unexpected results.

notes: The actual duration of the ability starts right after the 1.2 effect delay. The visual and sound effects during the effect delay are visible and audible to everyone.
The visual and sound effects during the effect delay are visible and audible to everyone.
Provides 350 range ground vision at the center of the area for 5.5 seconds upon cast

Stops enemies by slowing them with a slow aura. The aura has a radius of 408 and is centered on the field. The slow gets exponentially stronger towards the visible barrier, which has a 350 radius. This effectively causes enemy units touching the barrier to come to halt. The slow is only present when facing towards the barrier. Units at the barrier facing away from it are not slowed. The aura's effect lingers for 0.5 seconds, resulting in an effective duration of 3.1/3.7/4.3/4.9 (TagTalent 5.1/5.7/6.3/6.9) seconds. Since the slow is fluctuating a lot, it is not displayed in the HUD.
The slow gets exponentially stronger towards the visible barrier, which has a 350 radius.
This effectively causes enemy units touching the barrier to come to halt.
The slow is only present when facing towards the barrier. Units at the barrier facing away from it are not slowed.
The aura's effect lingers for 0.5 seconds, resulting in an effective duration of 3.1/3.7/4.3/4.9 (TagTalent 5.1/5.7/6.3/6.9) seconds.
Since the slow is fluctuating a lot, it is not displayed in the HUD.

Besides preventing enemies from walking in or out of the area, the following movement abilities are unable to pass the barrier either: Skewer, Leap, Pounce, Tree Dance, Primal Spring, Sun Ray, God's Rebuke, Force Staff, Hurricane Pike, Sinister Gaze, and Firesnap Cookie.
Skewer, Leap, Pounce, Tree Dance, Primal Spring, Sun Ray, God's Rebuke, Force Staff, Hurricane Pike, Sinister Gaze, and Firesnap Cookie.
abilities.description: After a short formation time, creates a circular barrier of kinetic energy that enemies can't pass.
params: The Barrier's modifier persists if it was placed before spell immunity.
The stryder is immune to the gale-force winds that will consume its adversaries.
abilities.story: The stryder is immune to the gale-force winds that will consume its adversaries.

notes: The silence and mute is provided by an aura, its effects do not linger.
Silences and mute invulnerable units, but not hidden units.

Deals a total of 20 damage instances over 5 (TagTalent 7) seconds, in 0.25-second (TagTalent 0.35-second) intervals. The damage on each instance is determined by the given max damage per second, divided by max instance, then multiplied by the current instance count.
The damage on each instance is determined by the given max damage per second, divided by max instance, then multiplied by the current instance count.
Can deal up to 525/721.875/918.75 damage to a single unit (before reductions).
Provides 450 range flying vision at the center of the area for 5 (TagTalent 7) seconds.
abilities.description: Creates a damaging static storm that also silences all enemy units in the area for the duration. The damage starts off weak, but increases in power over the duration.
params: A summer squall in Druud is a hardship that only an Oglodi can survive.
abilities.story: A summer squall in Druud is a hardship that only an Oglodi can survive.

description: Disruptor, the Stormcrafter, is a ranged intelligence hero who requires good positioning to use his abilities effectively. His signature ability is Kinetic Field, a pseudo-disable that traps enemies within a small area for a long duration. Combined with his Static Storm, Disruptor can act as the initiator for a teamfight, or supplement his teammates' initiation very well. Glimpse is another powerful spell that forces enemies to watch their movements, as Disruptor can easily drag them back to a previous location to be focused down. Thunder Strike provides Disruptor with some reliable single-target damage, but more importantly grants vision on the target to prevent jukes and escapes.
history: High on the wind-ravaged steppes of Druud, a gifted young stormcrafter called Disruptor was the first to unlock the secrets of the summer squalls. Constantly under assault from both seasonal storms and encroachment from civilized kingdoms to the South, the upland Oglodi have for centuries struggled to subsist atop the endless tablelands. They are the fractured remnant of a once-great civilization, a fallen tribe, their stormcraft strange and inscrutable, cobbled together from scraps of lost knowledge which even they no longer fully understand. For those on the high plain, weather has become a kind of religion, worshiped as both the giver and taker of life. But the electrical storms that bring life-sustaining rains arrive at a cost, and many are the charred and smoking corpses left in their wake. Although small for his kind, Disruptor is fearless, and driven by an insatiable curiosity. As a youth, while still unblooded and without a stryder, he explored the ruins of the ancestral cities, searching through collapsed and long-moldering libraries, rummaging through rusting manufactories. He took what he needed and returned to his tribe. Adapting a coil of ancient design, he harnessed the power of electrical differential and now calls down the thunder whenever he wishes. Part magic, part craftsmanship, his coils hold in their glowing plates the power of life and death—a power wielded with precision against the landed castes to the South, and any interlopers who cross into ancient Oglodi lands.
